HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: [Continued] Add Reversion Support for Record Level Deltas
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As an ingestion user, I want to be able to revert changes made to entities and have the derived deltas respect that change, so that the derived deltas process will be transparent to me and the database will not silently fail to update the data submitted (i.e., leave the database with incorrect data while reporting success).
 
The case where an ingestion user ingestions data with a specific student name, Sends a data set the next data with a change to that name, and the next day reverts that change back to the original is currently not handled (the last change will be ignored.
 
Acceptance Criteria:
 
Gherkin:
 
Scenario: Duplicate Creation Data Set
Given a data set has been ingested 
When the same data set is presented for ingestion
Then the entities are not updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are not updated
And no new hash records are created

Scenario:  Updated Data, Duplicate Update and Reversion
Given a data set has been ingested
When updates for that data set are presented for ingestion
Then the entitiess are updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash record are updated with an updated hash of the entity
And no new hash records are created
When the same updates are presented for ingestion
Then the entities are not updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are not updated
And no new hash records are created
When the original dataset is presented for ingestion
Then the entities are updated to the original values
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are updated to the original values
And no new hash records are created

Additional AT may be required for when the update to the hash record fails for some reason.

Testing Notes:

1. The original dataset to include examples of each type of entity
2. The update data set to include an update for each entity type
3. Ideally - The update data set to include updates of each entity field where it is valid to do so.  These are to be combined where possible.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: [Continued] Add Reversion Support for Record Level Deltas

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: [Unfinished] Add Reversion Support for Record Level Deltas
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As an ingestion user, I want to be able to revert changes made to entities and have the derived deltas respect that change so that the derived deltas process will be transparent to me.
 
 
The case where an ingestion user ingestions data with a specific student name, Sends a data set the next data with a change to that name, and the next day reverts that change back to the original is currently not handled (the last change will be ignored.
 
Acceptance Criteria:
 
Gherkin:
 
Scenario: Duplicate Creation Data Set
Given a data set has been ingested 
When the same data set is presented for ingestion
Then the entities are not updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are not updated
And no new hash records are created

Scenario:  Updated Data, Duplicate Update and Reversion
Given a data set has been ingested
When updates for that data set are presented for ingestion
Then the entitiess are updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash record are updated with an updated hash of the entity
And no new hash records are created
When the same updates are presented for ingestion
Then the entities are not updated
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are not updated
And no new hash records are created
When the original dataset is presented for ingestion
Then the entities are updated to the original values
And no new entities are created
And the hash records are updated to the original values
And no new hash records are created

Additional AT may be required for when the update to the hash record fails for some reason.

Testing Notes:

1. The original dataset to include examples of each type of entity
2. The update data set to include an update for each entity type
3. Ideally - The update data set to include updates of each entity field where it is valid to do so.  These are to be combined where possible.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: [Unfinished] Add Reversion Support for Record Level Deltas

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Runtimes Context Resolvers for Teacher (required for NYS Day 1 ingestion)
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
From Stephen:

Teacher stamping is more complicated and could not be added to the ingestion process. We decided the best solution moving forward was to move away from stamping teacher context in favor of runtime context resolution. This obviously adds many benefits. However we know there are some API calls that given certain datasets could cause problems. Our current thinking however is that these API calls are not normal use cases and the datasets are not normal. Our plan is to bring back the old teacher context resolvers with some improvements and when we find poor performing API calls that don't seem to meet valid use cases or which can be easily retrieved in a different way that is faster, we might deprecate the slow API call in favor of the faster way. And here I mean deprecate, not remove. Also if we find that building context for a teacher around what students, sections, programs, cohorts she can then we can cache this information per session. But we wont' go down that path until we have to.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Delete teacher stamper
  2. Remove teacher stamper from RC envs
  3. Remove teacher stamper for runbooks
  4. Remove padding for teacher stamps that exists in ingestion
  5. Remove indices that are no longer needed
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Runtimes Context Resolvers for Teacher (required for NYS Day 1 ingestion)

Task.refObjectName: Create mangler to keep query explosions out

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: EdOrg stamping (required for NYS Day 1 ingestion)
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
From Stephen: 
Move the EdOrg stamping into the ingestion pipeline. This effort is underway and looks pretty good. It will add some additional reads and updates to ingestion for some entities, but mostly entities with low numbers. For all entities that hang from student or section they can be stamped at the time they are inserted/updated in SLI database so without any additional writes or in most cases without additional reads.


Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Remove from runbook docs
  2. Turn of edorg stampers in RC envs
  3. Remove padding added for stamper stamping
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: EdOrg stamping (required for NYS Day 1 ingestion)

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
From Stephen:

General

Because edorg stampings are still used we need to update the stampings in 4 cases. The first two cases are when a studentSchoolAssociation is added or removed. This would add or remove the stamping of that schools edorg id on all of the data for that student. The third is if a studentSchoolAssociation studentId, schoolId, or endDate is changed via API call. The fourth is if there is an endDate on a studentSchoolAssociation  that expires. 
We broke it into 3 stories:

For this story

this is bulk of the work as this is the asynchronous job that would run to change data based on the addition or removal of a schoolAssociation for a student.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SEA/LEA End Users Writing Data Within Own EdOrg Hierarchy Only - Implementation
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As an SEA/LEA end user I would like to be able to write only to data within my hierarchy, so that, even though I can access data outside of it because I have association with particular student, I should not be writing into data that I don't own.


Acceptance Criteria:
  • No Create, Update or Delete outside of the EdOrg hierarchy to be allowed for SEA/LEA (federated) end user; Requirement - <PO> Requirements for US3722 - 1.0 MVP in https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Edorg+Restricted+Write
  • This should be a SLI level configuration
  • SEA/LEA end user should still have the Read access as currently defined
  • An analysis (NOT REQUIREMENT) about what can be considered as an EdOrg data: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=3587584&focusedCommentId=3587593&#comment-3587593
  • This change should be noted/updated in the following doc:  https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Contextual+Authorization+Business+Rules

Demo Script: 

A user with Write General and Write Restricted at a school level will have context with a student that is enrolled in both own and another school in the same district. He she will try to update data of the Student entity such as Student address. It will be allowed.He/She will then try to update data that belongs to the other school, a section with the other school. That should be unauthorized. 

A district level user with Write General and Write Restricted will make the same edits and will succeed that because both of the schools are in his/her district/EdOrg hierarchy)

A teacher of a student that goes to two schools will take a look at DisciplineIncidents and AttendanceEvents that belong to the other school. It will be allowed. He/she will then try to modify them. It will be forbidden.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SEA/LEA End Users Writing Data Within Own EdOrg Hierarchy Only - Implementation

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Implement TEACHER: Access to Historical Data of Past Students
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher at Agile Middle School, I would like to see all the students I have ever taught, regardless of whether I am teaching them now, from the grade in which I taught them back, so that…
 
EXAMPLE
 
8th Grade Language Arts Teacher Linda Kim of Agile Middle School has Matt in her class during the 2010-2011 school year. It is now the 2011-2012 school year and Ms. Kim is still teaching at Agile Middle School. Matt Sollars has gone on to 9th grade at Agile High School. However, Ms. Kim can still see Matt Sollars from 8th grade back.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

  • Sample data for student with past and future data
  • Test confirming historical access
  • Test confirming non-future access
  • Test with two or more instances of teacher with student (ie taught in 8th and 10th grades), validate appropriate access
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Implement TEACHER: Access to Historical Data of Past Students

Parent.refObjectName: Data Access Policy - Access to historical student data of past students

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Implement STAFF: Access to Historical Data of Past Students
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a staff member at Agile Middle School, I would like to see all the students who attended Agile Middle School during my time there, regardless of whether they are currently at Agile Middle School, up to and below the grade in which they attended Agile Middle School, so that…
 
EXAMPLE
 
Assistant Principal Joe Smith works at Agile Middle School for kids in grades 6-8 during the 2010-2011 school year. It is now the 2011-2012 school year and Mr. Smith is still the Assistant Principal at Agile Middle School. The 8th graders have moved on to 9th grade at Agile High School. However, Assistant Principal Smith can still see the 8th graders from last year’s class from 8th grade back.

AC:

Sample data for student with lots of history
Test historical access
Test inability to see future data
Test two associations and confirm proper access (ie staff at a child's elementary AND high school, and middle school data is available).
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Implement STAFF: Access to Historical Data of Past Students

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Admin Right for SEA/LEA federated end user
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a SEA/LEA super-admin I would like to have an Admin Right that can be added to the default and custom SEA/LEA end users, so that applications such as the Portal can use it for determining any administrative access for the users having this Right.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Right/flag that should be used to indicate whether a SEA/LEA federated user role is admin or not
  • This Right/flag does not give any right over data (like Read General, Write Restricted etc.do)
  • The Right/flag will be assigned to IT Administrator role by default
  • The Right/flag can be added to any default or custom role
  • Confluence documentation (with defect filed for Storm) explaining how an app dev can make a call/figure out whether the user has an 'admin' role or not.
  • Visually, this flag will be a check box (Giselle will provide UX or will work with dev)
  • Juggernauts to be informed when the right/flag is ready for their use in the Portal
  • Info about the admin flag/right will be put on the following page:  https://thesli.onconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2000832; a defect will be filed for Storm to update user documentation with this info.

Demo Script:

1. LS dev will go to role management page, will show how by default the right is assigned to IT administrator, then will remove it, add it to other default role and crate a custom role to which this right will be added. Reset to defaults will be clicked at the end to demonstrate that the default settings are reset.
2. LS dev will make API call for an 'admin' and not 'admin' role to demonstrate that the call returns that information.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Admin Right for SEA/LEA federated end user
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: In 6.4, the platform introduces a new 'admin' right. This right does not give any additional permissions to data, but instead flags the user role as 'admin' or non 'admin' role. This role will be assigned by default to IT Administrator, but as it is a case with the other roles, it can be added and removed to any of the default or custom roles. Currently, the Data Browser will use (check) this right to determine whether to allow the user to access the application. If the user has a role with this right, the access will be allowed. In future (Greg will know whether it is 6.5 or 66), the Portal will allow access to the Admin page of the Portal based on this right.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: DOC: Update admin docs for creating IT admins (new user right/role)
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Update admin docs for creating IT admins (new user role) in the custom role mapping tool.

DO (10/3): Is this a dupe?

MP (10/11): Talked to Lucky Strike about this story and received the following information

Back before custom roles exists, Portal looked at your role name to determine if you were an admin (such as an IT Admin for a school district) and should be able to view admin apps.

However, once we added custom roles, there was no guarantee what role a school district would give to their IT Admins since roles are arbitrarily named by the realm admin.  To get around that, we created the admin_apps right.  The realm administrator will just place that right on whichever role the IT Admin uses, and portal can then check for that right instead of the role.

It's related to this story:  https://rally1.rallydev.com/#/4983255020/detail/userstory/7673686315, (Admin Right for SEA/LEA federated end user) which is currently slated for 6.5
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: DOC: Update admin docs for creating IT admins (new user right/role)

As a Realm Administrator I would like to have an interface that will allow me to create custom roles and map my SEA/LEA roles to them in the same way I am mapping the SEA/LEA roles with the default SLI Roles.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • An interface that will allow the user to create additional roles on top of the 4 default roles.
  • The interface will be available to the Realm Administrators only
  • The custom roles will consist of already existing user rights: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2000832
  • A custom role must have at least one right.
  • The custom roles will be editable
  • Role group name should be unique (per realm) and cannot be an empty string (alphanumerical string).  
  • All the old mapping rules for the default roles apply to the custom roles
  • There should not be a maximum limit of custom role groups, but maybe we should make that a configurable parameter and set it (for now) to 20.  
  • api/rest/userapps api should be updated appropriately (Realm Administrator is the only one who can access it)
  • Row 16 - CRUD Custom Roles in the first table to be updated ( https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Hosted+Admin+Users)
  • A "Custom Role" text field in the impersonation page, that will allow the Sandbox user to impersonate a custom role as addition to the default roles 
  • File a defect to Storm for creating/updating custom roles/role mapping guide

Wireframes:
OLD NOT VALID. WAITING FOR THE NEW ONE FROM JAMES G

Demo Script: 

1. A realm admin will create few roles in the custom roles page, then go to the role mapping page and will see them. He/she will then go back to the custom roles page, delete them (receiving a warning) and go back to confirm that they do not exist. 

2. A realm admin will create 2 roles, one just with read general and read public and the other (Teacher) with read general, read public and read restricted. It will then map an IDP role that linda kim has to the Teacher role and then demonstrate that Linda Kim can see free and reduced lunch. Then he/she will delete teacher and map the role that Linda Kim has to Educator and show how she cannot see restricted (free reduced lunch) fields.

3. The realm admin will try to map same IDP role to one default and one custom role and will show that it cannot be done (not allowed)

4. Realm admin will try to create 2 custom roles with same name and a custom role with name as one of the default roles. Will be denied for the 2 cases.

5. Realm admin will try to create a custom role without choosing a single right. Will be denied

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Custom Roles - Custom Data Categories
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
<8/13 Janko> - Set by the client as WLTH for 1.0. Will be removed from a scheduled sprint

As a Realm Administrator, I would like to have the possibility to define my own data categories and define R/W rights for them so that I can create custom roles that are better tailored for my needs.

Split:

Change the existing storage of data categories - 8pts

Retrieve the data model through API - 5pts.

Copy + name change of category + remove and save ; they should appear in the custom roles - 5pts

Tree UI -  8pts


Background: A district have bought an attendance app and would like to allow their teachers taking attendance. They realize that they will have to modify the default role Educator, but if they use the default rights they will have to add Write General to the Educator role. Write General means that the teachers will be able to change the student's name as well. The certainly don't want that. By having the capability of defining custom data categories and R/W rights on them, the district will simply create for example "Custom Attendance" data category, and just add W Custom Attendance to the Educator role. District's teachers will now be able to take attendance without being given unnecessary rights.

Acceptance Criteria:

- Realm Administrator should be able to define own data categories through an UI and define R/W rights on them
- the admin will not be able to modify the default data categories
- the admin will be able to copy the default categories into a custom one that will be editable 
- all of the entities and attributes in our data model should be available for the custom data categories
- The admin can assign whatever rights they want to the roles, even though the rights could overlap (e.g. Attendance exists in General Data Category. The admin might create Custom 1 and put both Attendance and the attribute free and reduced lunch. If a role is being given R General and R Custom 1, the user that has that role will have R on the General Data Category + Free and reduced lunch).
- Entity/Attribute can exist in multiple data categories; 

Wireframes: Mistique wireframes in attachment

Demo Script: Linda Kim's district have procured an attendance app. The realm admin will go ahead, create a custom data category and add Attendance in it. It will then give W right to this custom data category to Educator role. Linda Kim will make an API call (eng preference how) to demonstrate that she (as a Teacher IDP role mapped to Educator) can take attendance.

Gherkin:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Custom Roles - Custom Data Categories

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Granular User Permissions - Custom Data Categories
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a Realm Administrator I would like to be able to define custom data categories (and R/W rights for them) so I could make the custom roles more flexible.  


TO DO - REVIEW, COPIED FROM 2936

As a Realm Administrator, I would like to have the possibility to define my own data categories and define R/W rights for them so that I can create custom roles that are better tailored for my needs.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Realm Administrator to be able to download a template where own data categories could be set
- An instruction about filling the template
- Template to be uploaded and R/W rights and data categories will overwrite the default (this will be indicated through the UI as well)
- Simple validation of the template to make sure that every entity/attribute has data category assigned to it
- If the user chooses to have own categories, no default roles will exist (even the custom ones that were created with the existing default data categories will not exist); the user will define roles and will do the mapping.
- We wouldn't want to delete the 'default roles mapping' in case (they exist already) the user wants to return them

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: (App Permissions) Application Registration Tool - Ask for Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As an app developer, I would like to inform the SEAs/LEAs what kind of rights my application requires, so it will work properly when authorized.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Additional required section above the Enable section will be added where the app developer will be able to describe what rights are required (in a text field)
  • There will be a text field (UX link here) limited to 1000 characters.
  • This field will be optional. Whatever is put there will be communicated with the SEA/LEA super admin in the app authorization tool
  • This text will be listed (on the bottom) in the application registration approval tool and visible when the application row is expanded, so the SLC Operator can see it
  • The app developer can edit its original selection

Wireframe: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Application+Registration+Tool+Wireframes

Demo Script: ACME app developer will log in to the Portal, choose app registration from the available links and will create an app and write a description and register the app. Then the app developer will enable the app for Daybreak. The LEA super admin for daybreak will see this message in the Application Authorization tool. SLC Operator will log in to the portal, will click on the app registration approval page, will see the new app from ACME will click on it to expand and will see the description put from the ACME developer at the bottom.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: App Permissions - Authorizing Application at Entity Level
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a LEA Super Administrator (or SEA Super Administrator on behalf of LEA), I would like to be able to decide what permissions at entity level will I give to the applications that I am authorizing for my district.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A functionality that will allow authorizing application at entity (association) level, by explicitly choosing them
  • What the user will be able to access is an intersection of the user and app rights. 
  • An UI in the Application Authorization Tool that will allow the LEA Super Admin (or its delegate) to choose which rights will be given to the application when the application is authorized for the District. This rights should be editable.
  • At all times there must be at least one choice (entity/association) selected
  • A message will be displayed to the admin for every application in the list, that will tell the LEA (or SEA) Super Administrator what kind of rights the app developer have asked for. Ref. US2988
  • The LEA (or SEA) Super Administrator has a choice if he/she wants to give the rights that were asked for or not
  • An email notification will be sent explaining what kind of rights have been granted to the app. If the app is denied, email will be sent again. TODO: Email template - work with Mistique and put it here: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Notifications
  • Includes Sandbox

Old Wireframes (for Mistique reference; will be removed when the new ones are done): https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Application+Authorization+Tool+Wireframes
NEW (VALID) Wireframes: TODO

Then the LEA Super Administrator will give the read restricted right to the Data Browser. The Leader will try to access the student again and will be able to see free and reduced lunch.

HierarchicalRequirement.Name: App Permissions - Authorizing Application at Entity Level
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: An application that is authorized by an LEA, can access the LEA's data based on the user's permissions (on which behalf the application is accessing LEA's data) and the application features/capabilities. The LEA can give complete, blanket access to an application, but cannot restrict permissions to a more specific level. Additional functionality will be built to allow the LEA to choose what rights over the existing data categories to give to certain application. The intersection of the user's and application's permissions and the application's capabilities will define in which way the user will be able to access the LEA's data. For example, if an application allows editing of general student data, and a user with IT Administrator role (which gives permission for editing student data) is using the application, he/she will not be able to edit any student data if this right has not been given to the application by the LEA.
